intro: Dionysia leucotricha, commonly known as the white-haired dionysia, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa and the Arabian Peninsula. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes many species with showy flowers and milky sap. The plant is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, white to pale green flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are opposite and often covered in fine, white hairs, giving it its common name. Dionysia leucotricha is typically found in arid or semi-arid environments, thriving in well-drained soils.
